results.title: Bootmen [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Dein Perry, Hilary Linstead and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Loosely based on director Dein Perry’s early life as a dancer, “Bootmen” is the story of two brothers - Sean (Adam Garcia) and Mitchell (Sam Worthington) - working in a steel mill in the industrial city of Newcastle. Both dream of one day escaping from the mill, Sean as a tap dancer in Sydney and Mitchell purchasing a tow truck to get out of the only life their stern father has ever known. Tension arrises between the brothers when Sean quits the mill to go to Sydney to study with a well known dance troupe and Mitchell moves in on Sean’s woman, Linda (Sophie Lee), both brothers finding themselves in love with her. “Bootmen” is a feel-good movie that is similar in genre to “Strictly Ballroom” and “The Full Monty”, a touching and sweet film with wonderful tap dancing sequences. Cast also includes William Zappa, Richard Carter and Susie Porter.

results.title: Malcolm [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, David Parker and Cascade Films
results.brief_description: Malcolm, a simple genius played by Colin Friels, loses his job at a Melbourne tram depot after building his own one-man tram and taking to the streets. With funds dwindling, Malcolm is forced to take in a lodger, a small time criminal who moves in with girlfriend, Judith. Frank soon realizes that Malcolm’s mechanical wizardry can help his career - the result - a series of oddball but unsuccessful robberies that culminates in the heist of the decade that stretches Malcolm’s devises to the full. “Malcolm” was critically acclaimed world wide and received eight AFI Awards including best director and best film.

results.title: The Sum of us [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Geoff Burton, Kevin Dowling, Hal McElroy, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description: Harry (Jack Thompson) is a widower whose life centres around getting his gay son, Jeff (Russell Crowe), to settle down with a nice man. They live together in working-class Sydney, sharing a home, a few beers and a shared bemusement about the rites of masculinity (both straight and queer) in the post-sexual revolution 1990s. Based on David Steven’s award-winning play, “The Sum of Us” is a wonderful comedy about sons and fathers, a loving tribute to the tenderness and comraderie that can be found between men. Though some gay and lesbian critics disliked the film because of its obvious stage-bound script and the unashamed masculinity of Crowe’s gay son, by focussing on working class rather than bourgeois sexuality, “The Sum of Us” can also be seen as a film that radically redefines the boundaries of Australian masculinity and sexuality. Crowe makes a handsome and likeable central character and Jack Thompson is wonderful as the committed, generous father willing to do whatever it takes to make his son happy.

results.title: Muriel's Wedding [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Peter Szabo and Associates, Film Victoria and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and out of place girl who would give anything to be like her bitchy friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself. A bitter-sweet and much acclaimed film which touches the essence of the themes of self-respect, identity and friendship. Toni Collette gives an inspired performance as Muriel and the supporting cast includes Bill Hunter, Sophie Lee, Jeanie Drynan and Rachel Griffiths.

results.title: Sunday Too Far Away [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Matt Carroll, Gil Brealey and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job - a group of shearers working on an outback station in 1955 in the months leading to the nine months shearers’ strike. While the gun shearer played by Jack Thompson is the central character, the focus of this episodic and unsentimental drama is on the communal values of the group rather than on those of the individual. Cinemaphotography by Geoff Burton. Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 08]
results.brief_description: A compilation of newsreel segments focusing on Australia. 1. ‘[Royal Melbourne Zoo]’ shows a family strolling through the zoo. 2. ‘[Nar Nar Goon Airport]’ 3. ‘Turtle Island’ includes footage of giant turtles on the beach, men riding the turtles in a light-hearted race, and a dead turtle being cut open to show its heart which continues to beat 48 hours after death. 4. ‘[Peach growing in Australia]’ captures Australia’s fruit growing and canning industry in the 30’s showing the orchards, the sorting and inspection area, women peeling and removing stones, and the mechanised canning and processing sections.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 12]
results.creator_credit: Kodak Cinegraph and Commonwealth Government of Australia
results.brief_description: A compilation of short newsreel segments. 1. ‘Where traffic is all wet’ captures the hustle and bustle of Shanghai harbour, followed by a Japanese harbour showing a ferry designed to take boats overland and a water tunnel. 2. ‘Glimpses of Australia’ takes a look at seals and penguins on Lady Julia Percy Island located 200 miles from Melbourne. 3. ‘A Glimpse of Canberra’ produced by the Development and Migration Commision visits parliament House. 4. ‘[Melbourne Zoo] shows Jimmy the champanzee, ostriches, tigers, lions, leopards, bears and a novelty segment showing a Mr Wilkie tugging at the tail of an accommodating tiger.

results.title: The Gift [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sam Raimi, Gary Lucchesi, Tom Rosenberg, James Jacks and Columbia
results.brief_description: Set in Georgia, Cate Blanchett plays Annie Wilson, a young widow with three children to look after. Following an accident that kills her husband, she relies on her psychic visions to give the townsfolk clairvoyant readings regarding their relationships and love lives to earn a little extra money. Annie receives visits from Valerie (Hilary Swank) who is married to Donnie Barksdale (Keanu Reeves), a psychotic wife abuser who warns Annie not to talk to his wife again or he will hurt her and her children. She also has to contend with his taunts of her being a witch - a feeling that is echoed by some of the locals. When young socialite Jessica King (Katie Holmes) goes missing, the local police and her fiancee ask Annie for her help in finding the body and leading them to the murderer. Screenplay by Billy Bob Thornton.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 07]
results.brief_description: A compilation of early silent footage featuring Australian and North American wildlife. Shows kangaroos, wallabies, bandicoots, opossum (including an albino opossum), wombat, koala, Tasmanian devil, platypus and echidna. Also shows footage at a real rodeo in Pendleton, Oregon and a fight betweena cobra and a mongoose.
